response.original_title: Olympe said to me : I didn't loose my head
response.overview: Olympe de Gouges's blood did not coagulate. It flows in my veins. During his beheading on  November 3, 1793, she declared: "The children of my country will avenge me". On January 21, 2017,  during the women's march, Angela Davis made a speech of resistance to those "who proclaim  the supremacy of the hetero-patriarchal white man", calling for an "inclusive and intersecting  feminism" that invites us all to join the resistance, with, among others, our art. With my body, I  wanted to make the connection between these two feminists, beyond centuries and borders,  while paying tribute to Helena Almeida, who died on September 25, 2018.
response.title: Olympe said to me : I didn't loose my head
